intro: Wahlenbergia ecklonii var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Wahlenbergia ecklonii var. gracilis is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
